main event: A ground-visual observation of a UFO was reported in Point Pleasant, New Jersey on 27 August 1954.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 3 to 10 seconds, and the object was described as a straight edge, slightly flattened on top, approximately 150 feet long and silver in color.
The UFO was seen moving at speeds above known jet aircraft speeds, traveling from north to south through an arc of twenty-five degrees across the sky.
No photographs were taken during the observation, and the comments suggested it could have been a meteor sighting.
The report also mentioned a sighting on 30 August 1955, indicating continuous and consistent UFO activity in the area.
The sighting was reported by credible witnesses affiliated with the USAF and included detailed information about the UFO's characteristics and behavior.
